track.descriptions: The true test of problem solving: when one realizes that time and memory aren't infinite.

Join our biggest contest, Week of Code 27! This is a 7 day contest beginning Monday, December 19th at 12:00am PDT. 

Each day, we’ll unlock a new challenge for you to solve. The top 10 hackers win exclusive HackerRank T-shirts. Sign up now and we’ll send you a quick reminder each day to keep you on track. See you on the leaderboard!

model.name: How Many Substrings?

model.ruby_template:
#!/bin/ruby

n,q = gets.strip.split(' ')
n = n.to_i
q = q.to_i
s = gets.strip
for a0 in (0..q-1)
    left,right = gets.strip.split(' ')
    left = left.to_i
    right = right.to_i
    # your code goes here
end
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    n_temp <- getLine
    let n_t = words n_temp
    let n = read $ n_t!!0 :: Int
    let q = read $ n_t!!1 :: Int
    s <- getLine
    forM_ [1..q] $ \a0  -> do
        left_temp <- getLine
        let left_t = words left_temp
        let left = read $ left_t!!0 :: Int
        let right = read $ left_t!!1 :: Int
        -- your code goes here


getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Count the number of substrings within an inclusive range of indices.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
        let [
          n_temp (read-line) 
          n_t (split n_temp #"\s+") 
          n (Integer/parseInt (n_t 0)) 
          q (Integer/parseInt (n_t 1)) 
        ]

      (
        let [
          s (read-line)  
        ]
      )

      (
        loop [a0 q]
        (when (> a0 0)

          (
            let [
              left_temp (read-line) 
              left_t (split left_temp #"\s+") 
              left (Integer/parseInt (left_t 0)) 
              right (Integer/parseInt (left_t 1)) 
            ]
          )

        ; your code goes here
        (recur (- a0 1) ) )
      )

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [N,Q]} = io:fread("", "~d~d"),
    { ok, [S]} = io:fread("", "~s"),
    Q_list = lists:seq(1,Q),
    lists:foreach( fun(Q0) ->
            { ok, [Left,Right]} = io:fread("", "~d~d"),
            % your code goes here
    end,Q_list),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.lua_template:
